intro: Wolfia brasiliensis, commonly known as the water spire or floating moss, is a small, aquatic plant that belongs to the family Zygnematales. It is a free-floating species that forms dense mats on the surface of freshwater bodies. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, and instead consists of simple, filamentous structures. Its reproductive structures are called zoospores, which are released into the water for dispersal. Wolfia brasiliensis plays a role in water filtration and provides habitat for small aquatic organisms.
